subject: statistics
title: Type I and Type II Errors
contentHtml:
In statistical hypothesis testing, two types of errors are crucial to understand: Type I and Type II errors.

A Type I error occurs when a true null hypothesis is rejected, while a Type II error occurs when a false null hypothesis is not rejected.
statement: \[H_0: \mu = \mu_0\quad vs.\quad H_1: \mu \neq \mu_0\] The probability of Type I error is α, and the probability of Type II error is β.",
intuition: Understanding these two types of errors helps you design tests that minimize false positives (Type I) and false negatives (Type II).
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, understanding Type I and Type II errors is crucial for designing robust models.

Type I errors occur when a true null hypothesis is rejected, while Type II errors occur when a false alternative hypothesis is not rejected.

Understanding these two types of errors is crucial in statistical hypothesis testing.

formula.name: Significance Level

theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the probability of both errors occurring is upper bounded by the significance level.

intuition: Type I errors can be costly, as they may lead to incorrect conclusions. Type II errors are less severe but still important, as they can result in missed opportunities or delayed action.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, understanding type I and type II errors is crucial for evaluating the performance of models.
